word_mean: 像差：光线通过某一透镜后产生不均匀的折射与聚焦，致使形成的图像失真
心脏病学上指电冲动传导过程的失常(差异性传导)
天体方向因不同观测者之间的相对运动引起的差异。
在光学系统中，由透镜材料的特性、折射或反射表面的几何形状引起实际像与理想像的偏差。

sentence.Network_en: Single people are treated as an aberration and made to pay a supplement.
sentence.Network_cn: 独身者被当成异类，而且要付一笔额外的费用。

sentence.Network_en: It became very clear that the incident was not just an aberration, it was not just a single incident.
sentence.Network_cn: 事实已经很清楚，这件事不是偶发的，它并不是一起孤立的事件。

sentence.Network_en: The removal of the chromatic aberration is then of primary importance.
sentence.Network_cn: 这时消除色差具有头等重要性.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin aberratio(n-), from aberrare 'to stray' (see aberrant)

entry.def: An aberration is an incident or way of behaving that is not typical.

example.ex: It became very clear that the incident was not just an aberration, it was not just a single incident.
example.tran: 事实已经很清楚，这件事不是偶发的，它并不是一起孤立的事件。

entry.tran: 不正常的怪人；异常行为
entry.def: If someone considers a person or their behaviour to be an aberration, they think that they are strange and not socially acceptable.

example.ex: Single people are treated as an aberration and made to pay a supplement.
example.tran: 独身者被当成异类，而且要付一笔额外的费用。

means.word_mean: 1. a state or condition markedly different from the norm
2. a disorder in one's mental state
3. an optical phenomenon resulting from the failure of a lens or mirror to produce a good image

auth_sentence.content: In contrast, Cook's shot was an aberration.
auth_sentence.res_content: In contrast, Cook's shot was an aberration.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In contrast, Cook's shot was an aberration.

auth_sentence.content: The slightest aberration would plunge him into a morass.
auth_sentence.res_content: The slightest aberration would plunge him into a morass.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The slightest aberration would plunge him into a morass.

auth_sentence.content: Just one obvious aberration mars an otherwise perfect reign.
auth_sentence.res_content: Just one obvious aberration mars an otherwise perfect reign.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Just one obvious aberration mars an otherwise perfect reign.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ab离开+errant[adj.错误的,脱离正途的]→离开[正确]走向错误
err漫游,犯错误+ant表形容词→adj.错误的,脱离正途的
err漫游,犯错误+atic表形容词→被人认为错误的→古怪的
err漫游,犯错误+oneous……的→adj.错误的,不正确的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 离开正路,脱离常规,色差
stems_affixes.word_buile: aberrant[[adj.越轨的,异常的]]驶鷑.离开正路,脱离常规,色差
err漫游,犯错误+atum表名词→[改正]错误得东西→正误表
err漫游,犯错误+or表名词→n.错误,过失
in无+err漫游,犯错误+ancy表名词→无错误
err漫游,犯错误→v.犯错误,出差错

jushi.english: The aberrations of his youth had long been forgotten.
jushi.chinese: 他年轻时的荒唐事早就置之脑后了。

jushi.english: There is an aberration in the computer program.
This is a temporary aberration and will soon be put right.
jushi.chinese: 这是暂时的偏差，很快就会被纠正。
